intro: Campylandra fargesiana, commonly known as the Sichuan bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Sichuan, China. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features lanceolate, hairy leaves. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested or rocky habitats. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
